EmailTemplate.name: RE: MBO Partners Call Follow up (1326996844.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO Partners Call Follow up (1326996844.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly: - - - - 90 Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE Hi Tom, Great question. The benefits premiums are deduced pre-tax from your business account. If there are no funds in your account the account will go negative and we will use the initial benefit deposit to zero out the balance. If you never need to use the initial deposit it will be refunded to you when you leave MBO and/or cancel your benefits. Please let me know if you have any questions. I am leaving early today but will respond in the morning. Thanks!Sara___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: From: <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com">sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. <span style='font-size:10.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"> Tom Glatt [mailto:tglatt@glattconsulting.com] Sent: Thursday, January 19, 2012 1:09 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Partners Call Follow up Got it. Related question that I should have added. What about benefits payments? I know you described that but can't remember the details. I assume we would need to pay some monthly premium if we were to take on insurance? How is that paid again? On Thu, Jan 19, 2012 at 10:04 AM, Sara Conde < <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com">sconde@mbopartners.com> wrote:Hi Tom, That is correct with one slight (but important) change, it’s when we receive the funds from the client not when we bill them. The only way MBO gets paid is when your client pays the invoice and sends the money to MBO. This will prompt the funds to show up in your business account and from there you can decide how you would like to payroll yourself form your business. Please let me know if you have any additional questions. Thanks! ___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Tom Glatt [mailto:tglatt@glattconsulting.com<span style='mso-bookmark:_MailOriginal>] Sent: Thursday, January 19, 2012 12:36 PM To: Sara Conde Subject: Re: MBO Partners Call Follow up Hi Sara, Question for you. We are paid (and pay MBO) only when we bill a client - is that right? I couldn't find in my notes where I referenced the process. Thanks!Tom On Wed, Jan 18, 2012 at 11:13 AM, Sara Conde < <http://mkto-l0128.com/track?t=c&&&&mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com?mkt_tok=2xUAKZjCb1ZVtFNiy%2FuVI735nDrOaY2kr7VzDrnl3cJUsyIUGIalUg%3D%3D" target="_blank">sconde@mbopartners.com> wrote:Dear Tom , It was a pleasure speaking with you. You’ll find everything that I referenced on our call by going here. We are also promoting our new meet the independents project and are taking applications if you would like to be featured. You can view the program by going here. I will follow up with you on Friday, as promised, should you have questions before then, please schedule a convenient time using my online schedule. Best regards,Sara___________________________________SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.comw: www.mbopartners.com Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential.
